alert.note: Alert for Lapeer; Macomb; Oakland; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 10:51AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lapeer, northeastern Oakland, Macomb and central St. Clair Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1050 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dryden to Oxford to near Clarkston. Movement was east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Almont and Dryden around 1055 AM EDT. Romeo, Rochester, Armada and Memphis around 1105 AM EDT. Mount Clemens, Richmond, Sterling Heights, Clinton and Macomb Township around 1110 AM EDT. New Baltimore and Marysville around 1120 AM EDT. St. Clair and Harsens Island around 1125 AM EDT. Algonac and Marine City around 1130 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Anchorville, Waterford, Shelby Township, Ray Center, Utica, Washington, Auburn Hills, Lake Angelus, Berville and Leonard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
